com.entity

Class GameCharacter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.entity.Entity
      • com.entity.GameCharacter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Enemy, Player

    public abstract class GameCharacter
extends Entity
    Any character in the game, including the player. This stores their health and mana values, and tracks their death and kills.
    Author:
    Christopher

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a character, setting their initial and maximum health and mana values to the passed paramteters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameCharacter

        public GameCharacter(java.lang.String name,
                     java.math.BigInteger maxHP,
                     java.math.BigInteger maxMana,
                     java.math.BigInteger attackDamage)
        Creates a character, setting their maximum health and mana to the given values. Current health and mana will also be set to these values.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the character.
        maxHP - current and maximum health to be set.
        maxMana - current and maximum mana to be set.
        attackDamage - damage dealt per hit.

      • GameCharacter

        public GameCharacter(java.lang.String name,
                     java.math.BigInteger initialHP,
                     java.math.BigInteger maxHP,
                     java.math.BigInteger currMana,
                     java.math.BigInteger maxMana,
                     java.math.BigInteger attackDamage)
        Creates a character, setting their initial and maximum health and mana values to the passed paramteters.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the character.
        initialHP - initial current HP of the character.
        maxHP - maximum health to be set to.
        currMana - initial mana of the character.
        maxMana - maximum mana to be set to.
        attackDamage - damag dealt per hit.

    • Method Detail

      • attack

        public java.math.BigInteger attack(GameCharacter target)
        Attacks the target, dealing their AttackDamage on average per hit. This is modified by 25% random variance either side. The takeDamage method of the target is then called with this damage as a parameter. Returns the amount of damage dealt by the attack.
        Parameters:
        target - Target to be attacked.
        Returns:
        the amount of damage dealt by the attack.

      • restoreHealth

        public void restoreHealth(java.math.BigInteger amount,
                          Entity source)
        Restores the given amount of health. If this would put the character above their maxHP, it will instead set them to maxHP.
        Parameters:
        amount - amount of health to restore.
        source - entity that restored the health.

      • takeDamage

        public void takeDamage(java.math.BigInteger amount,
                       Entity source)
        Causes the player to take the given amount of damage. If this would kill the character, the 'die' function is called.
        Parameters:
        amount - amount of damage to take.
        source - entity that caused the damage.

      • restoreMana

        public void restoreMana(java.math.BigInteger amount,
                        Entity source)
        Restores the given amount of mana. If this would put the character above their maxMana, it will instead set them to maxMana.
        Parameters:
        amount - Amount of mana to restore.
        source - entity that restored the mana.

      • spendMana

        public void spendMana(java.math.BigInteger amount,
                      Entity source)
        Reduces the amount of mana available to the character by a given amount. If this mana is unavailable, an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        amount - Amount of mana to spend
        source - entity that caused the reduction in mana.

        Returns:

        Returns:
